Browse the source code of netbsd/crypto/external/bsd/openssh/dist/uidswap.c

1/* $NetBSD: uidswap.c,v 1.9 2019/01/27 02:08:33 pgoyette Exp $ */
2/* $OpenBSD: uidswap.c,v 1.41 2018/07/18 11:34:04 dtucker Exp $ */
3
4/*
5 * Author: Tatu Ylonen <ylo@cs.hut.fi>
6 * Copyright (c) 1995 Tatu Ylonen <ylo@cs.hut.fi>, Espoo, Finland
7 * All rights reserved
8 * Code for uid-swapping.
9 *
10 * As far as I am concerned, the code I have written for this software
11 * can be used freely for any purpose. Any derived versions of this
12 * software must be clearly marked as such, and if the derived work is
13 * incompatible with the protocol description in the RFC file, it must be
14 * called by a name other than "ssh" or "Secure Shell".
15 */
16
17#include "includes.h"
18__RCSID("$NetBSD: uidswap.c,v 1.9 2019/01/27 02:08:33 pgoyette Exp $");
19#include <sys/param.h>
20#include <errno.h>
21#include <pwd.h>
22#include <string.h>
23#include <unistd.h>
24#include <limits.h>
25#include <stdarg.h>
26#include <stdlib.h>
27
28#include "log.h"
29#include "uidswap.h"
30
31/*
32 * Note: all these functions must work in all of the following cases:
33 * 1. euid=0, ruid=0
34 * 2. euid=0, ruid!=0
35 * 3. euid!=0, ruid!=0
36 * Additionally, they must work regardless of whether the system has
37 * POSIX saved uids or not.
38 */
39
40/* Lets assume that posix saved ids also work with seteuid, even though that
41 is not part of the posix specification. */
42
43/* Saved effective uid. */
44static int privileged = 0;
45static int temporarily_use_uid_effective = 0;
46static uid_t saved_euid, user_groups_uid;
47static gid_t saved_egid;
48static gid_t saved_egroups[NGROUPS_MAX], user_groups[NGROUPS_MAX];
49static int saved_egroupslen = -1, user_groupslen = -1;
50
51/*
52 * Temporarily changes to the given uid. If the effective user
53 * id is not root, this does nothing. This call cannot be nested.
54 */
55void
56temporarily_use_uid(struct passwd *pw)
57{
58 /* Save the current euid, and egroups. */
59 saved_euid = geteuid();
60 saved_egid = getegid();
61 debug("temporarily_use_uid: %u/%u (e=%u/%u)",
62 (u_int)pw->pw_uid, (u_int)pw->pw_gid,
63 (u_int)saved_euid, (u_int)saved_egid);
64 if (saved_euid != 0) {
65 privileged = 0;
66 return;
67 }
68 privileged = 1;
69 temporarily_use_uid_effective = 1;
70 saved_egroupslen = getgroups(NGROUPS_MAX, saved_egroups);
71 if (saved_egroupslen < 0)
72 fatal("getgroups: %.100s", strerror(errno));
73
74 /* set and save the user's groups */
75 if (user_groupslen == -1 || user_groups_uid != pw->pw_uid) {
76 if (initgroups(pw->pw_name, pw->pw_gid) < 0)
77 fatal("initgroups: %s: %.100s", pw->pw_name,
78 strerror(errno));
79 user_groupslen = getgroups(NGROUPS_MAX, user_groups);
80 if (user_groupslen < 0)
81 fatal("getgroups: %.100s", strerror(errno));
82 user_groups_uid = pw->pw_uid;
83 }
84 /* Set the effective uid to the given (unprivileged) uid. */
85 if (setgroups(user_groupslen, user_groups) < 0)
86 fatal("setgroups: %.100s", strerror(errno));
87 if (setegid(pw->pw_gid) < 0)
88 fatal("setegid %u: %.100s", (u_int)pw->pw_gid,
89 strerror(errno));
90 if (seteuid(pw->pw_uid) == -1)
91 fatal("seteuid %u: %.100s", (u_int)pw->pw_uid,
92 strerror(errno));
93}
94
95/*
96 * Restores to the original (privileged) uid.
97 */
98void
99restore_uid(void)
100{
101 /* it's a no-op unless privileged */
102 if (!privileged) {
103 debug("restore_uid: (unprivileged)");
104 return;
105 }
106 if (!temporarily_use_uid_effective)
107 fatal("restore_uid: temporarily_use_uid not effective");
108 debug("restore_uid: %u/%u", (u_int)saved_euid, (u_int)saved_egid);
109 /* Set the effective uid back to the saved privileged uid. */
110 if (seteuid(saved_euid) < 0)
111 fatal("seteuid %u: %.100s", (u_int)saved_euid, strerror(errno));
112 if (setgroups(saved_egroupslen, saved_egroups) < 0)
113 fatal("setgroups: %.100s", strerror(errno));
114 if (setegid(saved_egid) < 0)
115 fatal("setegid %u: %.100s", (u_int)saved_egid, strerror(errno));
116 temporarily_use_uid_effective = 0;
117}
118
119/*
120 * Permanently sets all uids to the given uid. This cannot be
121 * called while temporarily_use_uid is effective.
122 */
123void
124permanently_set_uid(struct passwd *pw)
125{
126 if (pw == NULL)
127 fatal("permanently_set_uid: no user given");
128 if (temporarily_use_uid_effective)
129 fatal("permanently_set_uid: temporarily_use_uid effective");
130 debug("permanently_set_uid: %u/%u", (u_int)pw->pw_uid,
131 (u_int)pw->pw_gid);
132
133 if (setgid(pw->pw_gid) < 0)
134 fatal("setgid %u: %.100s", (u_int)pw->pw_gid, strerror(errno));
135 if (setegid(pw->pw_gid) < 0)
136 fatal("setegid %u: %.100s", (u_int)pw->pw_gid, strerror(errno));
137
138 if (setuid(pw->pw_uid) < 0)
139 fatal("setuid %u: %.100s", (u_int)pw->pw_uid, strerror(errno));
140 if (seteuid(pw->pw_uid) < 0)
141 fatal("seteuid %u: %.100s", (u_int)pw->pw_uid, strerror(errno));
142
143 /* Verify GID drop was successful */
144 if (getgid() != pw->pw_gid || getegid() != pw->pw_gid) {
145 fatal("%s: egid incorrect gid:%u egid:%u (should be %u)",
146 __func__, (u_int)getgid(), (u_int)getegid(),
147 (u_int)pw->pw_gid);
148 }
149
150 /* Verify UID drop was successful */
151 if (getuid() != pw->pw_uid || geteuid() != pw->pw_uid) {
152 fatal("%s: euid incorrect uid:%u euid:%u (should be %u)",
153 __func__, (u_int)getuid(), (u_int)geteuid(),
154 (u_int)pw->pw_uid);
155 }
156}
157
